{{Infobox military person |honorific_prefix = |name =Marcel Joseph Maurice Nogues |honorific_suffix = |native_name = |native_name_lang = |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_date ={{Birth date|1895|01|24}} |death_date ={{Death date and age|1919|10|05|1895|01|24}} |birth_place =Paris, France |death_place = |placeofburial = |placeofburial_label = |placeofburial_coordinates = |nickname = |birth_name = |allegiance ={{flag|France|23px}} |branch =Artillery
Aviation |serviceyears =1914 – ca 1918 |rank =Sous lieutenant |servicenumber = |unit =[[6c Regiment d'Artilleie Coloniale]]
[[107c Regiment d'Artillerie Lourde]]
[[Escadrille 12]]
[[Escadrille 57]]
[[Escadrille 172]] |commands = |battles =[[World War I]] |battles_label = |awards = |relations = |laterwork = |signature = |website = }} Sous Lieutenant '''Marcel Joseph Maurice Nogues''' was a World War I [[flying ace]] credited with thirteen aerial victories. He was an ace over enemy observation balloons, as well as enemy airplanes.{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }} == World War I service == Nogues joined the artillery on 4 September 1914. After volunteering for pilot's training, he was detached from the artillery to aviation on 24 January 1916. He gained his Military Pilot's Brevet, No. 3486, on 20 May 1916. He then underwent a series of advanced training assignments, at [[Dijon]], [[Ambrieu]], [[Avord]], [[Cazau]], and [[Pau, Pyrénées-Atlantiques|Pau]]. On 26 September 1916, he was posted to Escadrille N12 (the 'N' representing [[Nieuport]]). On 4 March 1917, he shared a victory with [[Joseph de Sevin]]. He scored a second time on 12 April. The next day, Nogues was shot down, probably by [[Albert Dossenbach]] of [[Jasta 36]],http://www.theaerodrome.com/aces/france/nogues.php Retrieved on 13 July 2010. and fell into the enemy's hands. It did not take him long to escape and rejoin his squadron, as he was promoted from [[Maréchal-des-logis]] to [[Adjutant]] on 20 July 1917 and wounded by shrapnel on 13 August 1917.{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }} Upon recovery, he was reassigned to Escadrille Spa 57 as a [[Société Pour L'Aviation et ses Dérivés|Spad]] pilot on 12 April 1918. Nogues was credited with downing an [[Albatros Flugzeugwerke|Albatros]] over [[Assainvillers]] on 2 May 1918. He steadily accumulated victories through May and June, mostly solo, though he shared one with [[Jean Albert Fraissinet]]. On 4 July, for his ninth win, he shot down an enemy observation balloon, sharing the win with [[Andre Petit-Delchet]];http://www.theaerodrome.com/aces/france/nogues.php Retrieved on 13 July 2010. this victory brought him the Légion d'honneur. On 26 September 1918, Nogues became a [[balloon buster]] ace, downing his fifth gasbag for his thirteenth victory.{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }} == Postwar == As the war ended, Nogues was transferred to Escadrille 172. Along with his other decorations, he had earned the Croix de Guerre with a minimum of five [[palmes]].{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }} On 5 October 1919, Marcel Nogues died several hours after receiving a blow to the larynx in a rugby match .{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }}{{cite book |title= Le Figero, Tuesday, October 7, 1919 |page= 4 }} == Honors and awards == '''Chevalier de la Légion d'Honneur''' "Temporary Sous Lieutenant: pilot of exceptional strength and admirable bravery. He recently downed two enemy planes in flames, reporting therewith his 6th and 7th victories. One wound, Médaille Militaire for feats of war. Five citations."http://www.theaerodrome.com/aces/france/nogues.php Retrieved on 13 July 2010.{{cite book |title= ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' |page= 197 }} == References == {{reflist}} == Bibliography == * ''Over the Front: A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918'' Norman L. R. Franks, Frank W. Bailey. Grub Street, 1992. ISBN 0-948817-54-2, ISBN 978-0-948817-54-0. [[cz:Marcel Nogues]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Nogues, Marcel}} [[Category:French World War I flying aces]] [[Category:1895 births]] [[Category:1919 deaths]]
